name: High flow velocity or shear indicators
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: Bankfull floods do not cause excessive scour/fill; channel handles transport without frequent failures.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use imagery change detection to identify fresh bars or scour after moderate floods and confirm in the field where possible.

inputs.label: High flow velocity or shear indicators

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Scour and deposition patterns are well matched to substrate and channel type.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Mild signs of bed or bank stress.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Frequent instability at moderate floods with noticeable scour or bar expansion.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Severe mismatch with repeated blowouts or heavy aggradation at moderate flows.

references: Multi-date NAIP or other aerial imagery for change detection
